abstracts.cdata!:
Brazil's family health program
            (PSF) is promoting a proactive model of health care delivery
            in which family health care providers deliver quality basic
            care to households and communities. The program, initiated
            in 1994, has successfully and rapidly expanded coverage of
            primary health care in rural and peri-urban areas, reaching
            about one-fifth of the Brazilian population (38 million) by 2000.
